description: Detects tracking scripts on pages with medical context (procedures, treatments, etc.) that may expose data to unauthorized third parties

rules.title: Meta Pixel (Facebook) Detected
rules.description: Meta Pixel tracking detected on a page with medical context (procedures, treatments, etc.)
rules.why_it_matters: Covered entities must not disclose PHI to unauthorized third parties without proper authorization or BAA. Tracking pixels transmit IP addresses, user behavior, and page URLs that reveal medical context.
rules.what_happened: Meta Pixel detected on page containing medical context
rules.resolution: Remove Meta Pixel from all pages containing medical context
citations: 45 CFR § 164.502(a) - Uses and Disclosures of PHI
HHS Bulletin on Online Tracking Technologies (Dec 2022)

rules.title: Google Analytics Detected
rules.description: Google Analytics tracking detected on a page with medical context without confirmed Business Associate Agreement
rules.why_it_matters: Google Analytics can be HIPAA-compliant with proper configuration and a signed BAA. However, standard GA4 implementation without BAA violates HIPAA when used on pages with medical context.
rules.what_happened: Google Analytics detected on page with medical context without confirmed Business Associate Agreement
rules.resolution: Verify BAA with Google or remove analytics from pages with medical context
citations: 45 CFR § 164.502(e) - Standard: Disclosures to Business Associates
HHS Bulletin on Online Tracking Technologies (Dec 2022)

rules.title: TikTok Pixel Detected
rules.description: TikTok tracking pixel detected on a page with medical context (procedures, treatments, etc.)
rules.why_it_matters: TikTok pixel transmits user behavior and page context to TikTok's advertising platform. On healthcare pages, this constitutes unauthorized disclosure of medical context.
rules.what_happened: TikTok tracking pixel detected on page containing medical context
rules.resolution: Remove TikTok pixel from all pages with medical context
citations: 45 CFR § 164.502(a) - Uses and Disclosures of PHI
HHS Bulletin on Online Tracking Technologies (Dec 2022)

rules.title: Session Replay Tool Detected
rules.description: Session replay or screen recording tool detected on a page with medical context
rules.why_it_matters: Session replay tools record user interactions. On healthcare pages, these recordings may capture medical context such as symptoms or conditions, constituting unauthorized disclosure without a BAA.
rules.what_happened: Session replay or screen recording tool detected on page containing medical context
rules.resolution: Remove session replay tools from all pages containing medical context
citations: 45 CFR § 164.502(a) - Uses and Disclosures of PHI
HHS Bulletin on Online Tracking Technologies (Dec 2022)

rules.title: LinkedIn Insight Tag Detected
rules.description: LinkedIn Insight Tag tracking detected on a page with medical context
rules.why_it_matters: LinkedIn Insight Tag transmits user behavior and page context. On healthcare pages, this constitutes unauthorized disclosure as LinkedIn does not offer HIPAA-compliant tracking.
rules.what_happened: LinkedIn Insight Tag detected on page containing medical context
rules.resolution: Remove LinkedIn Insight Tag from all pages containing medical context
citations: 45 CFR § 164.502(a) - Uses and Disclosures of PHI
HHS Bulletin on Online Tracking Technologies (Dec 2022)

rules.title: Twitter/X Pixel Detected
rules.description: Twitter/X conversion tracking pixel detected on a page with medical context
rules.why_it_matters: Twitter/X pixel transmits user identifiers, page URLs, and behavioral data to Twitter/X's advertising platform. Twitter/X does not offer HIPAA-compliant tracking or BAAs. Use on healthcare pages creates unauthorized PHI disclosure.
rules.what_happened: Twitter/X pixel detected on page containing medical context
rules.resolution: Remove Twitter/X pixel from all pages containing medical context
citations: 45 CFR § 164.502(a) - Uses and Disclosures of PHI
HHS Bulletin on Online Tracking Technologies (Dec 2022)
